title: Redundancy and Cognitive Load Optimization: Experimental Design-Based Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Blended learning utilizing digital devices for current practitioners, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze redundancy across multiple information delivery modes (visual/auditory/text) and explain their impact on cognitive load

Over three weeks, learners conduct a project evaluating the interaction between modular redundancy and codal redundancy through experimental design-based learning, and write a 5-page comparative efficiency report based on A/B test data. The report must meet three criteria: (1) comparison of three or more experimental conditions, (2) use of quantitative metrics (e.g., system uptime, error reduction rate), (3) inclusion of at least two HR process improvement proposals

Learners apply Swellerâ€™s Cognitive Load Theory to design information delivery strategies when developing corporate internal manuals/training materials and evaluate cognitive load for three or more work scenarios using NASA-TLX or similar measurement tools
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
